intro: Polypodium paucijugum, commonly known as the few-lobed holly fern, is a member of the Polypodiaceae family and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a terrestrial fern characterized by its delicate, frond-like leaves that are typically divided into small, lance-shaped segments. The plant produces sporangia on the underside of its fronds, which are clustered in sori, a common feature among ferns. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in botanical studies.
